label: Folder 39: Whitelaw Letter 12
description: Letter to Thomas W. Perry from Robert N.S. Whitelaw regarding plans for off-street parking (Jan. 15, 1951).

metadata.label: Transcript
metadata.value: 15 January, 1951  Mr. Thomas W. Perry  83 Wentworth Street  Charleston, South Carolina  Dear Tom,  I see that the City is again taking an interest  in the off-street parking probem, and knowing that you  are much In favor of the plan that the Art  Association  developed, I am sending you the enclosed thinking that  you may not have retained it In your fie. We are no onger in a position to advance this  study, but if you and your committee would ike to meet  In my office to go over our fies, I hope that you will  consider that the fies and I personay am at your service. Pease though give me as much warning as you can  so that I can freshen up my memory and organise the arteria in order to save you time,  Haturaiy, much of the plan proposed in 1945 is  out of date. But, on the other hand, a considerable portion of it has been carried out by private individuals.  It would seem to me that a few new lots and coordination  of the existing ones would go s ong way toward soving  a problem thst seems to be vexing everyone.  Sincerely yours,  Robert N.S. Whitelaw, Director  Carolina Art  Association  RMSW cgs
